summary: The @temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry package v1.9.0 has a peer dependency conflict with @temporalio/activity, requiring file:// references instead of version numbers. This prevents installation even though other packages can be updated to v1.9.0 successfully.
userImpact: Users cannot install or upgrade @temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry v1.9.0 due to unresolvable peer dependency conflicts, blocking their ability to use OpenTelemetry integration with the updated SDK.
rootCause: The interceptors-opentelemetry package was published with peer dependency declarations using file:// references instead of version number ranges, making it incompatible with npm's dependency resolver when other packages were upgraded to v1.9.0.
proposedFix: Update the peer dependency declarations in the package to use proper version ranges instead of file references, as fixed in v1.9.1.
workaround: Use npm install with --force or --legacy-peer-deps flags to bypass the dependency check.
resolutionDetails: Published version 1.9.1 which corrects the peer dependency declarations, allowing normal installation without workarounds.
keyQuote: peer @temporalio/activity@"file:../activity" from @temporalio/interceptors-opentelemetry@1.9.0 - unable to resolve dependency tree
